results.definition: (tennis) a score consisting of winning a game when your opponent was serving
examples: he was up two breaks in the second set

results.definition: breaking of hard tissue such as bone
examples: the break seems to have been caused by a fall

results.definition: enter someone's (virtual or real) property in an unauthorized manner, usually with the intent to steal or commit a violent act
be released or become known; of news
fail to agree with; be in violation of; as of rules or patterns
an act of delaying or interrupting the continuity
examples: it was presented without commercial breaks

results.definition: lessen in force or effect
examples: break a fall

results.definition: an escape from jail
examples: the breakout was carefully planned

results.definition: interrupt a continued activity
force out or release suddenly and often violently something pent up
examples: break into tears

results.definition: any frame in which a bowler fails to make a strike or spare
examples: the break in the eighth frame cost him the match

results.definition: go to pieces
ruin completely
act in disregard of laws, rules, contracts, or promises
examples: break a law
break a promise

results.definition: become fractured; break or crack on the surface only
do a break dance
examples: Kids were break-dancing at the street corner

results.definition: prevent completion
examples: break off the negotiations

results.definition: become separated into pieces or fragments
make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret
hasTypes: let the cat out of the bag

results.definition: terminate
examples: break a lucky streak
break the cycle of poverty

results.definition: surpass in excellence
examples: break a record

results.definition: discontinue an association or relation; go different ways
the act of breaking something
examples: the breakage was unavoidable

results.definition: happen
break down, literally or metaphorically
a pause from doing something (as work)
examples: we took a 10-minute break

results.definition: stop operating or functioning
fracture a bone of
reduce to bankruptcy
examples: My daughter's fancy wedding is going to break me!

results.definition: assign to a lower position; reduce in rank
(geology) a crack in the earth's crust resulting from the displacement of one side with respect to the other
break a piece from a whole
examples: break a branch from a tree

results.definition: make submissive, obedient, or useful
examples: The horse was tough to break

results.definition: a time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something
move away or escape suddenly
examples: Nobody can break out--this prison is high security

results.definition: a personal or social separation (as between opposing factions)
examples: they hoped to avoid a break in relations

results.definition: some abrupt occurrence that interrupts an ongoing activity
examples: there was a break in the action when a player was hurt

results.definition: destroy the completeness of a set of related items
examples: The book dealer would not break the set

results.definition: cease an action temporarily
examples: let's break for lunch

results.definition: an unexpected piece of good luck
examples: he finally got his big break

results.definition: an abrupt change in the tone or register of the voice (as at puberty or due to emotion)
examples: then there was a break in her voice

results.definition: a sudden dash
examples: he made a break for the open door

results.definition: be broken in
examples: If the new teacher won't break, we'll add some stress

results.definition: become punctured or penetrated
cause the failure or ruin of
examples: This play will either make or break the playwright

results.definition: cause to give up a habit
change directions suddenly
change suddenly from one tone quality or register to another
come forth or begin from a state of latency
come into being
come to an end
crack; of the male voice in puberty
examples: his voice is breaking--he should no longer sing in the choir

results.definition: curl over and fall apart in surf or foam, of waves
destroy the integrity of; usually by force; cause to separate into pieces or fragments
diminish or discontinue abruptly
emerge from the surface of a body of water
exchange for smaller units of money
examples: I had to break a $100 bill just to buy the candy

results.definition: fall sharply
find a flaw in
examples: break an alibi
break down a proof

results.definition: find the solution or key to
examples: break the code

results.definition: give up
examples: break cigarette smoking

results.definition: happen or take place
examples: Things have been breaking pretty well for us in the past few months

results.definition: interrupt the flow of current in
examples: break a circuit

make a rupture in the ranks of the enemy or one's own by quitting or fleeing
make the opening shot that scatters the balls
pierce or penetrate
render inoperable or ineffective
scatter or part
separate from a clinch, in boxing
the occurrence of breaking

undergo breaking
